item.title: Recognition for a community of volunteers
item.description: Do you know a community hero who dedicates their own time and skills on behalf of others? Well, we want to hear about them.

item.title: Storm Goretti: Folkestone & Hythe update
item.description: Work is already underway to deal with the effects of Storm Goretti after the district’s coastline faced strong and forceful winds overnight.

item.title: Skill up your business for the new year and beyond
item.description: An exciting skills programme to strengthen the local economy and support small business growth across the district has been launched.

item.title: Taking a look at our financial future
item.description: Residents have the opportunity to comment on Folkestone & Hythe District Council’s budget strategy for 2026/27.

item.title: Mindful Messy Making 2026
item.description: Following the success of last years taster sessions we are delighted to be running another series of creative peer support sessions facilitated by Sarah Lloyd. I found I could say things with colour and shapes that I couldn’t say any other way – things I had no words for.” – …

item.title: Christmas is a time for giving
item.description: A bundle of thoughtful gifts will be shared to vulnerable children and young people in the district on Christmas Day thanks to a council initiative.

item.title: Launch of Crowdfunder
item.description: The Board of Trustees of the Romney Marsh Community Hub charity, which this year marks its 50th anniversary serving the Marsh, has launched an urgent fundraising appeal to raise £150,000 to safeguard essential services for local residents. The charity has been hit hard by a combination of soaring op…

item.title: How to Get Involved in Folkestone’s Future (Even if You’re Busy)
item.description: We all want to live in a town that feels welcoming, inspiring, and cared for. But for many of us, the thought of “getting involved” feels daunting. Who has hours of spare time these days? The good news is that supporting Folkestone’s future doesn’t require huge amounts of time. With Go Folkestone, t…

item.title: Why Local History Still Matters in a Modern Town
item.description: We live in a fast-paced world. Towns change, skylines shift, and new businesses come and go. It can be tempting to think heritage is something we leave in museums or history books. But in reality, local history is what gives a place its character – and without it, we risk losing not only our i…

item.title: Small Acts, Big Change: How Community Projects Shape a Town
item.description: When you picture the kind of projects that change a town, you might think of large-scale developments or huge investments. But often, the most lasting impact comes from the small, consistent actions of people who care. That’s the heart of what Go Folkestone has been doing for more than 20 years &#82…

item.title: Shuffler Launch at Our Hub
item.description: We are proud to be one of only three sites in Kent chosen to launch and test the SHUFFLER® — a new portable seated exercise device. The SHUFFLER® was co-designed by an NHS doctor to help improve mobility and stability in a simple, hassle-free way. It is suitable for people of all abilities — includi…

item.title: Fantastic Funday Fundraiser
item.description: Lindau Residential Home in New Romney held a funday on Saturday 9 August. It was a busy and happy day. There was live music from Driss, a BBQ, a cake stall, face painting, line dancing, and the biggest raffle we have ever seen. The sun was shining. Residents enjoyed the day with their family and fri…

item.title: David’s 80th Birthday Bucket List Item Takes Off!
item.description: Our amazing volunteer, David Stokes, decided to celebrate his upcoming 80th birthday in the most adventurous way possible — by doing a wing walk! On Friday 1 August, David climbed onto the top of a plane at Headcorn Aerodrome and soared through the skies, ticking off a top item from his bucket list.…
